question.title: Java write byte[] to file - empty file

node.contents: Are you sure you're looking at the right file?

astNode.text: Are you sure you're looking at the right file?

node.contents: Are you sure the code you have here actually ran? You don't log it in any way; Either "out.txt" is not where you think it is, or this code didn't run. There is nothing wrong with the sample you've posted

astNode.text: Are you sure the code you have here actually ran? You don't log it in any way; Either "out.txt" is not where you think it is, or this code didn't run. There is nothing wrong with the sample you've posted

node.contents: This code seems perfectly correct, it should copy the text.

astNode.text: This code seems perfectly correct, it should copy the text.

node.contents: You guys were right. I had created "out.txt" in my Java project Web Pages directory, but the java servlet has a different working directory (given by: `System.getProperty("user.dir")` ). So the file was created in a different location.

astNode.text: You guys were right. I had created "out.txt" in my Java project Web Pages directory, but the java servlet has a different working directory (given by: `System.getProperty("user.dir")` ). So the file was created in a different location.

elements.contents: // Open bin file for writing: String s = "Hello"; FileOutputStream binOutput = new FileOutputStream("out.txt"); byte[] b; b = s.getBytes(); binOutput.write(b); binOutput.close();

units.rawText: // Open bin file for writing: String s = "Hello"; FileOutputStream binOutput = new FileOutputStream("out.txt"); byte[] b; b = s.getBytes(); binOutputwrite(b); binOutputclose();

node.contents: The above code was run from a java servlet page After this, I checked "out.txt" but it remained empty. It seems like a trivial task. What am I missing?

astNode.text: The above code was run from a java servlet page After this, I checked "out.txt" but it remained empty. It seems like a trivial task. What am I missing?

node.contents: No. `FileOutputStream` inherits `flush()` from `OuputStream,` where it is specified to do nothing.

astNode.text: No. `FileOutputStream` inherits `flush()` from `OuputStream,` where it is specified to do nothing.
